name: Edition 9 - May 2011
description: For the media, May was a big month. The world celebrated in the British Royal Wedding as well as the death of the 9/11 mastermind, Osama Bin Laden. Meanwhile, the war continued in Libya which shed a new light on the French military, markets debated about the eventual compromise struck on the American fiscal budget and Europe took a moment to remember the Chernobyl nuclear accident on its twenty-fifth anniversary. Also featured in May's Edition of The Frankfurt Globe are stories on Africa, the return of Right-Wing politics in Europe, sustainable development and an exclusive interview with Renate Lingor in the run-up to Germany's FIFA Women's World Cup 2011.
